item.title: Quick use of Git cherry-pick
item.dc:creator: Suraj Koli
item.description:
1) Cherry pick commit from someone’s repository: git fetch someoneRepoRemoteName OR git fetch someoneRepoRemoteName branchName git log someoneRepoRemoteName/branchName git cherry-pick 00dc218 2) Cherry pick commit from same repository: git fetch yourRepoRemoteName OR git fetch yourRepoRemoteName branchName git log yourRepoRemoteName/branchName git…

The post Quick use of Git cherry-pick appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
1) Cherry pick commit from someone’s repository:

git fetch someoneRepoRemoteName OR git fetch someoneRepoRemoteName branchName

git log someoneRepoRemoteName/branchName

git cherry-pick 00dc218

2) Cherry pick commit from same repository:

git fetch yourRepoRemoteName OR git fetch yourRepoRemoteName branchName

git log yourRepoRemoteName/branchName

git cherry-pick 00dc218

The post Quick use of Git cherry-pick appeared first on .

item.title: Deploy code without git root repository
item.dc:creator: Suraj Koli
item.description:
Steps: Clone your git repository git clone https://github.com/demo/demo.git . where “.” dot represents current directory. done..

The post Deploy code without git root repository appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Steps:

Clone your git repository git clone https://github.com/demo/demo.git .

where “.” dot represents current directory.

done..
